The evidence that Shakespeare knew Latin is growing stronger every year. I have recently shown that Portia’s great speech in the Merclrant af Venice, IV. 1, 184-aoo‚ is based on Seneca’s De Clementia, of which there was no English translation prior to that of Lodge, published in 1614, i. e. some twenty years after the probable date of the Marciani of Venice (see my paper at the Congress of Arts and Science, St. Louis, U.S.A., 1904, vol. iii, p. 189 f., republished in the Natienal Review for June, 1906).-I hope before long to publish evidence showing the in· flnence of Plautus upon many plays of Shakespeare.
